description: First pass of influence analysis: identifies all thinkers cited, invoked, or referenced in the author's work. Maps citation patterns, distinguishes between substantive engagement and name-dropping.
researcher_question: Who are the thinkers this author draws upon, and how are they invoked?

thinkers.name: string - full name of the thinker
works_referenced: string - specific works cited if any
quote_samples: string - key quotes invoking this thinker

most_cited: string - thinker names ordered by frequency

thinkers_for_verification: string - thinkers requiring external text lookup

extraction.core_question: Who are the intellectual sources this author draws upon?
extraction_steps: SCAN FOR NAMES: Find all proper names of thinkers, theorists, philosophers, scholars
MAP CITATIONS: Note where and how each thinker is cited or invoked
ASSESS DEPTH: Distinguish deep engagement from name-dropping
IDENTIFY ROLE: Determine what role each thinker plays (authority, target, interlocutor)
CATALOG CONTEXTS: Record the contexts in which each thinker appears
extraction.special_instructions: Be thorough - catch allusions and conceptual borrowings, not just explicit citations. Note when concepts are used without attribution.

consolidation_rules: Merge multiple references to same thinker

concretization.naming_guidance: Use thinker name with citation count and engagement level
